title: (x) Ambassador Scotch ad - Landry Gothic {Jan}
content:
I’m looking for the body copy used in the following ad:

Any help is greatly appreciated.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Ambassador\_poorworkingpeople.preview.jpeg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071024010934/http:/typophile.com/files/Ambassador_poorworkingpeople.preview.jpeg) | 26.05 KB |

 [‹ (x) Type on playing cards - Numbers Deuce {Koleslaw}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071024010934/http:/typophile.com/node/18736 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) The Fast And The Furious movie logo - Antique Olive Nord {Sebastian} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071024010934/http:/typophile.com/node/18731 "Go to next forum topic")
author: johndiggity

comments.content: This is a really nice old gothic. The closest I can get is [Rhode Medium](http://web.archive.org/web/20071024010934/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=FB.100194.0.1&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=IFTHEYWORKED&sampleSize=30), but the ’R’ and ’K’ is special and I think we would see a lot of irregularity in the forms if we had a closer look.
Also in this category is Heinrich Lischka’s [Neo Retro](http://web.archive.org/web/20071024010934/http:/www.typografski.de/fontboutique/pages/e_free_neoretro.html).
It looks very much like Knockout (Cruiserweight), but there are a few tiny differences - the “E”s and the question mark are not quite the same. Really close, though.
If it’s a bit “soft” in the corners and abit clumsy, it might be [Landry Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20071024010934/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ephemera/landry-gothic/)

I was going bleary-eyed looking at Sans samples at MyFonts, and when I hit Andrew Lehman’s ’Landry Gothic’, I said that’s it! Jan, I think you nailed it. To me it has all the right earmarks.

- Mike Yanega
I think Landry’s spot on. Thanks a bunch everyone. I appreciate it.
